name: Doubletree by Hilton Cambridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night but definitely enjoyed our stay. Finding the hotel was a bit of a hassle with the GPS which had a hard time navigating in the narrow, medieval streets of many small English cities. Keep driving even though it looks like you may have gone too far. It is indeed located behind Peterhouse College.
reviews.title: Nice stay by the Cam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious and clean. We had a view of the river (which I only noticed the next morning) which was really nice. Overall the hotel is in a peaceful area and has a parking lot which is wonderful if you are arriving by car.
reviews.title: Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The only disappointing aspect of our stay was the breakfast. The breakfast room has a great view and is nice but everything from the tea to the food offered at the buffet was well below standard. They had very little to offer in terms of fresh food (the bread selection was sad by European standards) or fruit. The pancake and waffle maker also broke right when we got there so there were very few options for a satisfying meal. Still if one overlooks the lack of a good breakfast selection I think this is a great option when visiting this lovely college town.
reviews.title: Excellent food in a great location

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location in Cambridge. It is close to the town centre but has all the luxury you would expect from a Hilton Hotel. We were upgraded into a junior suite which was fantastic, with views over the river Cam. The room was spacious with a huge comfortable bed. It is only a short walk to the university gardens and the town centre.
reviews.title: Hotel by theCam

reviews.text: We stayed early April on third floor with excellent view of the river. Agree with comments re wi-if cost as most coffee houses and hotels now have no charge. Think rooms are a little pricey (unless it was to include car park ) however are well furnished and very comfortable. All staff encountered were very helpful and friendly and the welcome cookie is a nice touch after a journey. The lounge and bar area is great for relaxing and plenty of pleasant outdoor space for better weather. The bar makes wicked cocktails -must try the "town and gown". The greatest thing about this hotel is the riverside brasserie. We ate here every night and also ate here when we were staying out of town on business. The food is excellent,well prepared,fresh and very good value. Try the venison or chateaubriand for a real treat but we didn't have one criticism about the food. Also worked my way down the desserts and recommend the Marsala cream with choc soil. The service was good and we were amazed how few people appear to have found the place as it is so good. Will also write a review in the restaurants section for good measure! My advice to the general manager is hold on to the chef and we will be back as often as we can. Thanks for some great evenings.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Last time I visited this hotel it was about to undergo refurbishment so I wasn't altogether surprised at how grubby my room was. This time I specifically asked for a refurbished room and it was indeed considerably better. The rest of the hotel though still looked rather shabby and the air conditioning in the room wasn't working properly.
reviews.title: Dissappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position of the hotel is perfect though and if it is just a place to stay then it is perfectly adequate. We had an ok meal in the restaurant in the evening. Food fine but a little pricey for what it was. Certainly the wine list was overpriced (over £6 for the cheapest glass of wine!).
reviews.title: Simply very good

reviews.text: Was very disappointed to be charged £17 for parking my car! That seems to be unnecessary penny pinching.
reviews.title: 4 night stay and once again a pleasant and welcoming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did love the warm cookie on arrival though!
reviews.title: Not so special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Smart & modern hotel by the river.
reviews.title: car parking a rip off

reviews.text: There is no doubt that this hotel is the perfect location in Cambridge, right on the river with a nice brasserie overlooking.
reviews.title: Great location but too expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was nice, the room clean and food good.
reviews.title: Would definately recommend.

reviews.text: However when you pay almost £220 for a double room (overlooking the car park) I think additional charges such as £17.50 for the car park, £7 for an hour of WiFi and £18 per person for breakfast are unfair and too expensive. You expect charges for budget airlines and travelodge hotels not 4 star hotels. As I was told its Hilton policy and for this reason alone I won't be returning. It's a shame because it is a nice hotel, just too expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent stay. Lovely staff. Very good food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I appreciate that Cambridge parking is expensive, other hotels offer free parking in Cambridge, and breakfast charges are standard but I wouldn't expect this of this priced room at the quality it is.
reviews.title: Just one tiny complaint

reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay in a river view king room. It's a welcoming, clean, modern, beautifully furnished hotel in the centre of Cambridge. We had a lovely breakfast with lots to choose from and very good evening cocktails in the bar. The room had Ipod connection, which was also great. There was air-con in the room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.text: We stayed on a Saturday night and had an excellent stay. We booked the rooms on an offer (no refunds so when it started to snow earlier in the day it could have been interesting...) Good sized twin rooms, bathroom was ok (nothing too special) but overall the hotel was perfect and suited our requirements. The best part was its great location.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent location

reviews.text: Paying to park your car when you're staying at the hotel annoyed me slightly as it should have been included in the rooom rate ...
reviews.title: Ideal location for shoping and colleges

reviews.text: Sunday breakfast was ok - a buffet set-up and some of the hot breakfast items had definitely been sitting around for a while.
reviews.title: One of the better hotels in Cambridge. Pricey!

reviews.text: Swimming pool a little on the small size and basic BUT then you're not paying over the odds to stay there.
reviews.title: Conference manager review

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel three times now, location is great for shoping and sight seeing. The hotel is very quite and relaxing an ideal choice if you are thinking of a hotel to stay at if you are attending a college interview or open day. Parking is very easy and the indoor pool is very nice. Breakfast Was perfect and check In was very efficient as our room was ready before the check in time. Would recommend a balcony/ river view suit.
reviews.title: Good for business or pleasure.
Excellent service
reviews.text: Just had afternoon tea at Doubletree. It was a wonderful location overlooking the river. The service was excellent the only thing that let it down slightly is the bread for the sandwiches was slightly dry, however, cakes more than made up for this. I would certainly visit again. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Hilton in Cambridge as we wanted to visit our son at university but didnt want to lodge in student accommodation. As I had some Hilton HHonors points, this seemed like a sensible place to stay. The hotel is reasonably well placed, just a few minutes walk from the town centre and right next to the Cam, where punts could be hired if you were hardy enough. The rooms were well appointed and the breakfast was very good value. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Ideal Location for visiting Cambridge
Excellent service
reviews.text: Great staff and a great location. Rooms quite expensive but nevertheless well appointed and furnished. Showers a bit of a trickle on the third floor but a minor gripe as is the rather mean cost of wi-fi [£6.50 an hour] and £18 daily parking charge. Free parking exists in Cambridge off Grange Road if you don't mind a ten minute walk]. Real selling point here after the location is the staff. Great asset.
May i just thank all the staff for making our stay thoroughly enjoyable. From the moment we arrived the staff were some of the nicest and most professional people I have come across.
reviews.title: All round excellent! Staff, location, hotel!

reviews.text: The room was lovely and impeccably clean. And the location......well.....if on the river....a stones thrown from bars and restaurants.....punting and activities on your door step is bad location then I give up! It was perfect!
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room not clean. Foil found under bed!
reviews.title: It is the little things that matter!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shower-very poor, reported, nothing done. The flow was so poor I could not wash the conditioner out of my hair. On the second day, as the shower was so bad I decided to wait until I got home!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Breakfast, drinks order taken, then forgotten. Both days there were no plates for the hot food and I had to ask. On the second day the pancake machine had disappeared.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was convenient and well decorated. We paid for a river view so our two night stay was expensive considering the service we recieved.
reviews.title: Great little night away.

reviews.text: Next time I will stay in college!
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is clean & modern, but the large bed was hard with cheap pillows.The view over the river was nice but the inground uplights lit up the whole room all night..the drapes were for show and didn't shut.
reviews.title: One night was enough

reviews.text: The staff in the bar and for breakfast were very helpful..charging overnight guests £18 to park the car is plain robbery..it should be free..and you had to pay extra for wifi.
reviews.title: Snobbish Reception Staff

reviews.text: We had reached hotel 45 minutes past midnight and were checked in.
reviews.title: Excellent in every aspect highly recommended!

reviews.text: Next morning the reception staff was snobbish and would not answer politely. On arrival for Breakfast we were not helped for specific requirements. I had to search on my own. They offered only orange juice when other juices were available.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about the cleanliness!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The curtains were not closed so due to light could pass in at 6.00am and I was awake, although I went to bed at 2.00am.
reviews.title: A decent hotel near the centre

reviews.text: The Doubletree by Hilton is a good quality modern hotel in an almost perfect location on the riverside in central Cambridge. The décor is elegant and modern with spacious public areas and large guest rooms with huge beds. A few minor niggles annoyed more than spoilt the stay: rooms have spring water available but only at a cost from the mini bar, and whilst there was a good selection of teas there was only one tea bag of each type meaning if two of you want a plain cup of tea you have to share a tea bag. Unnecessarily mean. If you wanted to access the internet you could use the pcs in the Business Centre for free however if you wanted to connect your own device there was a charge for the privilege which grates. Equally the hotel has a large car park which is great but the charge for 24 hours as a guest is a wopping £17.50. Daylight robbery!
reviews.title: Good hotel but spoilt by a function

reviews.text: Dinner in the hotel's own restaurant was excellent and frankly very good value at £21.50 for three courses, but drinks were expensive.
reviews.title: Solid Business Hotel Ticked All the Boxes

reviews.text: However after a long day when we wanted to retire to our room and catch up some much-needed sleep we found there was a function in one of the main rooms with a disco at ear-shattering volumes. This continued until 11.30pm and sleep was totally impossible until it stopped. I fail to understand why I should pay for a room in order to sleep only to have a hotel inflict this sort of volume on me. It was so loud there was not even any possibility of watching the television as the noise would have drowned out the programmes.
reviews.title: 2nd time's a charm

reviews.text: A shame as this is a really nice hotel that feels a little bit special but the little things, (plus the great big issue of noise on this particular evening), kind of took the shine off it.
reviews.title: A lovely city hotel in a perfect location with a personal touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend checking with the management before booking a Saturday night here unless you like 80's disco music....
reviews.title: 2 nights in Cambridge

description: Doubletree by Hilton Cambridge is a four star hotel surrounded by the River Cam, minutes from the city centre. The 122 refurbished en-suite bedrooms feature a plasma flat screen television, air-conditioning, mini fridge, iron & ironing board and laptop safe. Upgraded executive bedrooms and suites, including the Penthouse Suite are also available. Four air conditioned function rooms are ideal for large or small events and the refurbished Riverside Brasserie is perfect for fine dining.
